content: thank you for your interest in this pattern please feel free to contact me at crochetallstuff@gmail com if you need anything or find any problems with this pattern i appreciate all your comments sincerely 1 yarn 2 crochet hook i use a 3 0mm hook and my base is about 3 inches in diameter 3 scissors 4 tapestry needle for weaving 5 stitch marker optional us terms magic_ring = magic_ring round = round st = stitch chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet = double_crochet stitch space = space fst = flower stitch * the gap is created between stitches double_crochet-increase = double_crochet increase stitch ch1-space = the space has been created by 1 work 2 double_crochet in 1 stitch chain double_crochet-space = the space between two ch3-space = the space has been created by 3 consecutive double_crochet stitches chains total number of stitches in each round x n times repeat instructions written within brackets n times * flower stitch - make 6 double_crochet stitches in the stitch or space indicated in the pattern - drop the loop from your hook pull the loop on the hook a little larger for easier to grab later - count back to the first double_crochet stitch insert the hook from front to back under the 2 top loops of the first double_crochet stitch grab the dropped loop with your hook pull it through the first double_crochet stitch and then you can tighten the loop - chain 3 work a slip_stitch into the first double_crochet stitch slip_stitch into the next double_crochet stitch chain 3 slip_stitch into the same stitch x 5 times this is a 6-petal flower if you like a 5-petal flower just start with 5 double_crochet stitches note - the coaster is crocheted in rounds so start and close each round in whatever way works for you start with the double_crochet chain method/standing double_crochet stitch… and end with/without slip_stitch - many articles indicate that 10 to 14 starting double_crochet stitches will give a perfect circle but it depends on you for me it is 14 stitches - you don t need to worry if the base is sometimes ruffled or curled you can block it or simply put your coffee cup on it base part round 1 14dc into magic_ring 14 round 2 14dc-increase 28 round 3 1dc 1dc-increase x 14 times 42 round 4 3dc ch1 x 14 times 42 double_crochet 14 ch1-space cut the yarn join in the round and weave in green part round 5 start from any ch1-space work 1dc ch3 1dc in each ch1-space x 14 times 14 v-stitches or 14 ch3-space and 14 double_crochet-space cut the yarn join in the round and weave in flower part type 1 separated flowers work 1fst in any ch3-space cut the yarn and weave in x 14 times 14 flowers type 2 connected flowers slip_stitch in any double_crochet-space ch2 1fst in the next ch3-space ch2 1sc in the next double_crochet-space ** x 14 times 14 flowers
